definition: lit. count by fives and tens (idiom); to narrate systematically and in full detail
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
five/5
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
ten/10

sentences.english: He told his boss the whole story exactly as it had happened.
sentences.chinese: 他把事情一五一十地都给他的上司讲了。

sentences.english: He told his wife about the matter without hiding anything.
sentences.chinese: 他把事情一五一十都给妻子讲了。

sentences.english: He told his parents the whole story exactly as it had happened.
sentences.chinese: 他把事情一五一十地都给父母讲了。

sentences.english: I think it's better to spell out all to you.
sentences.chinese: 我想最好还是把事情一五一十地全告诉你。

sentences.english: E. g. she told him the gory details of her past.
sentences.chinese: 她把她的过去一五一十地告诉了他。

sentences.english: When the two girls asked her what was going on she spurted out.
sentences.chinese: 两女孩问起缘故，拉拉一五一十地说了。

sentences.english: Mrs. long has just been here, and she told me all about it.
sentences.chinese: 郎太太刚刚来过，她把这使一五一十地全告诉我了。

sentences.english: If you don‘t want to lose me,you‘d better lay it on the line.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不想失去我，就最好一五一十地告诉我。

sentences.english: She told me the whole story word for word.
sentences.chinese: 她把事情一五一十地告诉了我。

sentences.english: She told him the gory details of her past.
sentences.chinese: 她把她的过去一五一十地告诉了他。

definition: from beginning to end/in its entirety/in accord with fact/literal
variant of 原原本本[yuan2 yuan2 ben3 ben3]
lit. to put everything out including the tray/to reveal everything/to make a clean breast of it all
to pour beans out of a bamboo tube/to come clean/to make a clean breast of things
lit. to add oil and vinegar/fig. adding details while telling a story (to make it more interesting)
cause and effects (idiom); entire process of development
the whole story
without missing a word
actual situation/truth
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
to add interest (to a story)/to sex up
to pass on (stories)/to relate
to repeat (one's own words or sb else's)/(in the classroom) to paraphrase what one has learned
variant of 複述|复述[fu4 shu4]
variant of 交代[jiao1 dai4]
erhua variant of 一股腦|一股脑[yi1 gu3 nao3]
to hum and haw (idiom); to mumble as if hiding sth/to speak and break off, then start again/to hold sth back
